result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide DNA sample (unless previously given). Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to include the DNA surcharge. Bail on deposit to apply. Defendant to pay $50.00 per month starting on 7/18/2016. If any payments are late or missed, a civil judgment will be entered. Court WAIVED all NON-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Huber for work.

CONDITIONS OF HUBER RELEASE
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with Maria C. TOB, and TBJ, unless approved by Family Court.

*Huber privileges to be removed if violation of these conditions.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenton Jerome Braddock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard. Sarah Zwach, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Molly Schmidt for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 8 days time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Defendant to report to the House of Correction by 5:00pm on 7/17/2015.

CONDITIONS OF HUBER RELEASE
-Absolute sobriety
-No contact with Marla C., TOB, and TJB, unless approved by Family Court.

*Huber privileges to be removed if violation of these conditions.

-Defendant to provide DNA sample (unless previously given)
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to include the DNA surcharge. Bail on deposit to apply. Defendant to pay $50.00 per month starting on 7/18/2016. If any payments are late or missed, a civil judgment will be entered.
-Court WAIVED all NON-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Sentencing Referral Form

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, and provide a DNA sample. Court VACATED the Jury Trail date. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 Amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer ( 939.62(1)(b)).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements (Signed), and Notice of Intent to Introduce DVD of Child Interview At Trial.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court PRO SE.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised the court he retained Christopher Carson, who was unable to make today's court date.   Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing until next court date. Court adjourned the Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court, PRO SE.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant in court without counsel, not SPD eligible. Defendant advised court he has retained private counsel. Defendant advised conditions of bail remain in effect. Court adjourned case for Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: MARLA C., TOB ( DOB: 10/19/2007), TJB ( DOB: 10/5/2006),
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  
Defendant Trenton Jerome Braddock in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defense moves to Strike" Repeater" Modifier. Arguments heard. Court DENIED defense motion. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
UPON RELEASE DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALITY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

ADDRESS INFO for Trenton Jerome Braddock
Current: 4262 N 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2015)
Prior: 6235 Walnut Lane, #4, Cudahy, WI 53110
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
